sentence: Yahoo Finance's Jared Blikre joins Myles Udland to break down the day's price action in bitcoin as well as a long in Procter & Gamble (PG), a Yahoo Finance Premium Investment Idea.
Not a subscriber?
http://finance.yahoo.com/premium-marketing?yahooproperties_editorialv_wcz7njuyytq">Start your free trial to join our next webinar on Wednesday, November 4 at 2:00pm ET live!
MYLES UDLAND: Let's go over to Jared Blikre now for a look at the markets.
And Jared, let's start with something we were remiss in leaving out earlier, which was Bitcoin up again today.
And we've now got Bitcoin popping above-- I saw someone earlier today, saying, I love breakouts above rising triangles.
And I know that that is something near and dear to your technical heart.
JARED BLIKRE: Yes, I, too, love breakouts from rising triangles.
And guess what?
We have a two-year triangle consolidation period that has broken out of.
It actually did that a couple of months ago, came back down, and retested its breakout level.
And I'm going to find this on my chart and show everybody what I'm talking about maybe.
There we go.
Here's Bitcoin.
Let's take a look here.
Over a longer term, we do have that triangle of configuration here.
And we'll go to a five-year chart so we can see the all-time highs.
And the latest breakout was largely on the news that PayPal is going to be accepting-- allowing users to pay, deposit, redeem in Bitcoin.
And as of next year, there are going to be 27 million merchants who can accept payment in Bitcoin because of this.
So we're seeing a nice advance here, holding above 13,000.
I laid out the case for a 16,000 price target.
That's fairly conservative based on the potential momentum here, especially given the fact that we consolidated for a couple of years here.
And the upshot is, I've maintained my actual all-time price target was $188,000.
And I've increased that now to about $280,000.
Why, you ask.
Because of tulips.
In tulip mania, one tulip sold for the price of a house.
So you take the median house price in America, and that's how I got to my back of the envelope calculation there.
So let's turn our attention now to the Yahoo Finance Premium Investment Idea of the Day.
And this is Procter & Gamble.
And this is a fundamental call by Argus Research.
You can see over the last five years, up 89%.
Over the last six months, been a solid performer.
During the pandemic, up about 18.9%.
Not bad for a staple.
And here is a research report by Argus.
They are raising their price target to $160 from $150.
And the reasoning is because of their recent earnings.
On October 20, P&G reported better than expected fiscal first quarter EPS on an impressive 9% increase in organic sales.
And getting to the punch line down here, based on a discounted free cash flow model, we would put the value of shares as about $155 to $165, raising our price target to $160 from $150.
Also believe that the 2.2% dividend yield is very attractive in the current environment.
Myles.
